column1: '''Frumgar''' was the fourth [[Lord of the Éothéod]] and the grandson of [[Forthwini]].<ref group=note>His father's name is not recorded.</ref>
During his youth the [[Éothéod]] lived in the [[Vales of Anduin]], near [[Mirkwood
column2: Mirkwood Forest]]. It was a dangerous area, beleaguered by the creatures of the [[Necromancer]] at [[Dol Guldur]]. However, in {{TA
column4: Kingdom of Angmar]] was [[Battle of Fornost
column5: destroyed]], freeing up land to the north. In {{TA
column6: 1977}} Frumgar led the Éothéod to the vale between the rivers [[Greylin]] and [[Langwell]].<ref>{{App

column1: The settlement later known as [[Framsburg]] after his son, [[Fram]], was built there.<ref>''[[A Map of Middle-earth]]''</ref>
The [[Old English]] word ''frum'' means "beginning". Frumgar can be interpreted as "chieftain".
